wheelerpoker wrote:
> 
> 
> Thanks for the comment, but the equals implementations for collections
> use the equals() methods of their elements/entries, so a deep
> comparison wouldn't be performed. Am I missing something?

I have found it usually to be wise to teach objects to compare 
themselves to each other, rather than trying to compare them to each 
other "from the outside".

In other words, I've tried what you're doing, and I didn't like where I 
ended up, so I recommend you go another direction, but that's just one 
man's opinion.
